data.title: Untitled Document
data.text:
Mike McVay On The Rise At Cumulus Media; Extends With Long-Term Contract

THE MOUTH, APRIL 2ND, 2015 –– Cumulus Media Has Added Some New Content To Mike McVay's title as he now becomes SVP, CONTENT & Programming. Concurrently, Cumulus has extended its long-term contract with McVay. McVay who has held the corporate programming ranks since September 2011 will continue to report to John Dickey, Executive Vice President, Content & Programming for Cumulus. McVay is a 40-year programming professional with consulting, management, ownership, sales, programming and on-air experience, and has developed and launched several nationally syndicated programs. He has programmed more than 800 stations around the world, including stations across the U.S., Canada, Mexico, United Kingdom, Australia, New Zealand, Grand Cayman and Puerto Rico. In 1984, McVay and his wife Doris McVay launched McVay Media, a programming consultancy recognized around the world as the leader in its field. He has also owned or managed radio stations in Honolulu, Cleveland, Naples, Key West and Flint, Michigan. McVay was also one of the founding partners of Listener Driven Radio. Dickey said: “This title adjustment reflects the job that Mike’s been doing. This move acknowledges his value to the company. We hope to have Mike with us for many years to come.” McVay said: “I’m thrilled to continue to work for John and Lew and with the entire corporate programming team. Cumulus has added, and continues to add, some brilliant minds to the management and programming teams." He added, We’re having fun!”

MOTION: ALT AZ Adds Star Power To Inaugural Lineup

THE MOUTH, APRIL 2ND, 2015 –– Phoenix's KDKB (ALT AZ 93.3) has announced the hiring of its first three on-air personalities, following its re-launch as an alternative outlet last year. Christy Taylor (below left) will join as midday host and music director. ALT AZ adds Taylor to a lineup that includes the recently hired Dustin Carlson (below rig ht) in afternoons, and Phoenix-area native Monique “Mo” Rodriguez in evenings. Taylor arrives from Go 96.3/Minneapolis. She previously worked at 91X/San Diego, first as music director and later as program director, while handling evening on-air duties. She has also worked full-time at The Edge and Fly 92 in Albany, NY, and part-time at K-Rock/New York. Carlson joined ALT AZ in March from Boston, where he did evenings and imaging at Top 40 WODS. He is also a veteran of the alternative format and the desert, having logged over seven years as the afternoon host, imaging director, and assistant program director at KXTE/Las Vegas. Rodriguez joined ALT AZ as its first hire, from sister station KUPD/Phoenix, where she did part-time and fill-in shifts.

Bob and Brian On Demand, Now Anytime, Anywhere at BobAndBrianWorld.com

THE MOUTH, APRIL 2ND, 2015 –– Fans of 102.9 the Hog/Milwaukee's Bob and Brian can now enjoy the morning show duo anytime of day. BobAndBrianWorld.com relaunches as a turbocharged home for today's comedy and more than thirty years of archives from their radio vault. "To those dreamers who have pined for more Bob and Brian, your dreams have come true,” said Brian Nelson. "We're now not only on your radio, we're on your phone, your tablet, your laptop and your desktop. We're not yet able to appear as holograms in your bedroom, but that would just be creepy anyway." "Fans of the show will love BobAndBrianWorld.com," said Bob Madden. "Now, you are in charge of when and where you hear us, and now you can see us, too. We make no apologies to employers for the subsequent downturn in employee productivity, by the way." Bob Madden and Brian Nelson entered the Milwaukee market in July of 1987, when their current station held the call letters WLZR and was known as Lazer 103. The Bob and Brian show airs weekdays from 5:30 to 10:15 am on WHQG 102.9 FM in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. Those interested in sponsorship opportunities at BobAndBrianWorld.com are encouraged to contact Edge Messaging at 262-290-3343.

NIELSEN: Heavy Radio Listeners Spend Nearly Nine Hours A Week Online

THE MOUTH, APRIL 2ND, 2015 –– In a recent study of Media's Mega Users, Nielsen Media showed that heavy viewers and listeners are often considered the ‘super fans’ of the media ecosystem. These power users devote significant hours of their lives to one medium or another and are the most likely to consistently engage with content and advertising found on those channels. Nielsen released the Audio report profiling the listening habits of the 243 million Americans who use radio each week. The report also included a profile of the heaviest users across four media sectors. And an interesting headline emerged: heavy radio listeners and heavy TV viewers are, for the most part, mutually exclusive. Heavy TV viewers watch nearly double the amount of TV each week as heavy radio listeners, and conversely, heavy radio listeners listen to nearly double the amount of radio each week as heavy TV viewers. Based on habits alone, it is highly unlikely that a heavy radio listener would also be a heavy TV viewer because the heavy radio listener is much more likely to be away from home more often—where TV viewing is less likely to occur. This is a major reason why the findings of other Nielsen studies which have shown that radio does an exceptional job of increasing TV tune-in, particularly in the days and hours leading up to a premier or other primetime event. Heavy radio listeners spend nearly nine hours a week online, second only to the heavy Internet group at over 16 hours weekly. And both of these groups are very likely to use social media to stay connected; nearly all (92%) heavy Internet users also use social media, and three-quarters of heavy radio listeners do, too. SEE MORE HERE

EXECUTIVE ACTION: Beasley Names Shannon Kelley Corporate DODC; Adlarge Promotes Ilwira Marciszek And Stephanie Vance

THE MOUTH, APRIL 2ND, 2015 –– Beasley Media Group, Inc., a subsidiary of Beasley Broadcast Group, Inc., has appointed Shannon Kelley to the newly-created position of Corporate Director of Digital Content. Most recently, Shannon served as Director of Digital Content for the Beasley Media Group Charlotte cluster, which includes 5 FM and 2 AM radio stations. She began her career in broadcast media with CBS Radio in May of 2000 at the inception of the company’s digital presence. Working her way up the ladder from Webmaster to Digital Content Manager and then to Digital Content Director for the 7 station Charlotte cluster.

AdLarge Media has promoted Ilwira Marciszek (R) to Director, Ad Operations from Senior Manager and Stephanie Vance (far right) becomes Director, Revenue Planning & Development from Manager, Business Operations. “Ilwira and Stephanie have been an integral part of AdLarge Media’s growth,” said Cathy Csukas, Co-Founder and Co-Chief Executive Officer, AdLarge Media. “Investing in great talent is key to our success, and I am delighted to recognize their contributions with these well-deserved promotions.” About AdLarge Media (www.adlarge.com)

FORMATICS: WSJZ-FM Signs On As All-New 95 Rock

THE MOUTH, APRIL 2ND, 2015 –– Cumulus Media announces that WSJZ-FM Melbourne has rebooted as the all-new 95 Rock, Brevard’s Rock Station. WSJZ-FM and sister station WLZR-AM were previously programmed as a Sports combo. WLZR-AM will continue programming as Sports Radio AM 1560 The Fan, the Space Coast’s ESPN Radio affiliate. The new on-air lineup for 95 Rock will feature: Mornings with Bubba the Love Sponge, followed by Marci Wiser in Middays, Pyke@Night, and Loveline for Late Night. 95 Rock also begins its search for a new Program Director/Afternoon Drive host. All interested candidates are encouraged to apply at cumulusradio.jobs@cumulus.com (EEO) with the subject line: 95 Rock. Troy Hanson, Corporate Program Director/Rock Formats for Cumulus said: “We are delighted (yep, I’m bringing that word back) to bring Rock back to Melbourne with Brevard’s Rock Station 95 Rock. The Space Coast is ready to wake up with Bubba and his talented crew, and will now get a full dose of great bands like Foo Fighters, Pearl Jam, Linkin Park, Guns n’ Roses, The Black Keys, AC/DC, Nirvana and more.”

WWO Presents Exclusive Audio Coverage of the NCAA® Final Four®

THE MOUTH, APRIL 2ND, 2015 –– Westwood One, presents exclusive audio coverage of the 2015 NCAA Men’s Final Four in Indianapolis on Saturday, April 4, 2015 and the NCAA® Men’s Division I Championship Game on Monday, April 6, 2015. In addition to game coverage, Westwood One is taking the experience to the next level with a robust Radio Row presence and a consumer event at NCAA Final Four Fan Fest presented by Capital One®--a four-day interactive event for thousands of fans. Westwood One will be on site giving fans the opportunity to do their own broadcast video which they can share on social media while mingling with celebrities, athletes, and coaches who come through Fan Fest. The Final Four Show. Game coverage begins at 4:30 pm ET with Michigan State vs. Duke, followed by Wisconsin vs. Kentucky. Westwood One Sports’ Kevin Kugler will provide the play-by-play, and Clark Kellogg will be the game analyst. Former UCLA All-American and three-time NCAA Player of the Year Bill Walton contributes analysis to the broadcast and Jim Gray serves as courtside reporter. Jason Horowitz hosts the pregame and halftime shows, with contributions from Alaa Abdelnaby and Bill Frieder.

PHOTO OP'S: Stevie Ray Visits The Sound's Mark In The Morning; The Jason Smith Show Welcomes Basketball Great Jamaal Wilkes To The Studio [LISTEN]

THE MOUTH, APRIL 2ND, 2015 –– By total coincidence, a couple of LA related stories landed in our inboxSteven “Little Steven” Van Zandt was in Los Angeles last week and stopped by the local affiliate of his highly successful weekly show, Little Steven’s Underground Garage. While at the station, Steven met with staff members, programming executives and also appeared live on the new “Mark in the Morning” program starring Mark Thompson. Thompson has been heard on KSWD, “The Sound” since February 2nd, and Van Zandt’s visit last Friday (3/27) was his first appearance on Thompson’s new show (photo attached). Created in 2002, the Little Steven’s Underground Garage is broadcast for two hours per week, and its long-running top affiliates include WAXQ/ New York, WMGK/Philadelphia, KSWD/Los Angeles, WXRT/Chicago, WCSX/Detroit as well as dozens of outlets around the globe including the Voice of America. For more info, contact Andy Denemark -- (212) 536.3603 -- andyd@unitedstations.com

This week, two-time NCAA Champion and four-time NBA Champion Jamaal Wilkes joined FOX Sports Radio’s The Jason Smith Show to discuss the NBA’s controversial "tanking" issue. In the interview, Wilkes says “tanking” -- a team's intent to do less than everything it can to win -- is ok as long as you’re developing younger players. Wilkes also discussed his book “Jamaal Wilkes: Memoirs of The Original Smooth As Silk,” and his playing days at UCLA and with the Lakers and Warriors. Pictured left to right: Jason Smith, Jamaal Wilkes and co-host Michael Harmon. LISTEN TO INTERVIEW HERE

Tom Hanks Son Threatens Howard Stern In Twitter Rant

'One day, maybe tomorrow, maybe 10 years from now, I am going to see you in person, and I am going to hurt you… I hope you travel with security!!!'

THE MOUTH, APRIL 1ST, 2015 –– Rapper Chet Haze, son of famed actor Tom Hanks, has raised his long-term feud with Howard Stern to a new level, calling the radio icon a “c*nt” and threatening to assault him, according to gossipcop.com. The feud goes back in 2011, when Stern first mocked Haze for his rap persona.

Following an appearance on SiriusXM' Rude Jude Show in January where the host added his own knocks on the rapper, Jude appeared on Stern's show and subject turned to Haze. Then on March 20th, Haze tweeted (condensed) “Listening to the @HowardStern show this sh*t isn’t funny at all…' He added, “@HowardStern your time has passed… You’re old… Only old people listen to you… The young generation doesn’t know you.” This past Monday, he unloaded again in a Twitter rant at Stern, posting: 'Let me come up on your show b*tch… Come catch this fade… have me live on the air and we can go pound for pound see who looks like the fool you dried up old c*nt catch this fade… ....Howie… Do you have any idea how badly I am going to assault you when I see you… You can’t run from me forever knock knees… Howie… Listen. One day, maybe tomorrow, maybe 10 years from now, I am going to see you in person, and I am going to hurt you… I hope you travel with security!!! PLEASE have me on the show… I’ll sh*t on you and your yuppie side kicks on your own show… " His comments were far from over. CLICK HERE FOR MORE

REPORT: Casey Kasem Secretly Ducked Death Threats

THE MOUTH, APRIL 1ST, 2015 –– While a criminal investigation is still pending in the death of radio icon Casey Kasem, reportedly, the longtime American Top 40 host had secretly ducked death threats from fanatics and others according to The Daily Beast. The outlet learned in a recent FBI document dump that Kasem, who cemented his Hollywood star as the inventor of the American Top 40, was secretly ducking death threats from a few fanatics—and at least one lover of an art-rock band, too. Long before he was struck with Lewy disease, people came at Casey Kasem with 'crank phone calls and fatal attraction letters. '

During the summer of 1980, a woman made a visit to the Watermark Studio in Los Angeles. There, she tried to kiss Kasem during a photo shoot. “During the picture session she attempted to kiss him but he backed away from her,” the FBI documents say. Kasem ordered his staff to make sure sure she was swiftly sent off in a cab back to the airport after the show’s taping. The fan thought the Kasem was in love with her. But when the divorced Kasem married Jean Thompson, she started writing letters on Christmas Eve in 1980 accusing Kasem of rape, alcoholism, and molesting his kids. “By the end of June or else—I’ll come out to California and kill you, your ‘wife’ and your three kids—this is a promise. I’ll do it too because I know where you work,” she wrote in one letter, found in the FBI trove. She added, “a bullet through your heart will be first and then I’ll pour kerosene on your dead body and torch you until its charred.” There were many other incidents that followed. Afterward Kasem agreed to let his phone line be tapped, FBI records show. READ FULL STORY HERE

Baltimore's Sarah Fleischer Leaving The Air At 98 Rock After 38-Year Run; LA's ALT 98.7 Welcomes Sebastian Davis As Executive Producer For The Woody Show

THE MOUTH, APRIL 1ST, 2015 –– Sarah Fleischer is leaving the airwaves at 98 Rock after 38 years at the Baltimore rock outlet. She made the announcement on 98 Rock's "Morning Show with Justin, Scott & Spiegel." According to a station release, it stated that Sarah has been an on-air personality for all 38 years of 98 Rock’s existence – an anomaly in the ever fluctuating media world. A 2002 inductee in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum, the radio icon with the sultry voice and genuine enthusiasm for her job, has become an institution - dubbed Baltimore’s Queen of Rock. A Baltimore native, Sarah graduated from The Broadcasting Institute of Maryland in 1976 and landed a job at WMAR-FM – a beautiful music station. Rumors circulated that WIYY-FM was changing from an all-news to all-rock format. Sarah, a rocker at heart, placed a call to the Program Director at that time, and was hired as one of the first 98 Rock personalities. The rest, as they say, is history.' According to The Baltimore Sun, Fleischer said "I have been so privileged to have such a great ride. I’ve spent thirty eight years at the greatest rock station in the country! I’ve worked with the best in the business and made many wonderful friends and memories here. I am entering a new chapter in my life and I want the time to enjoy it."

iHeartMedia Los Angeles' ALT 98.7 announced Sebastian Davis as the new executive producer of The Woody Show, beginning April 6. He arrives from WNNX in Atlanta where he also served as the Executive Morning Producer. The Woody Show is driven by a cast of characters: Woody, Ravey, Menace and Greg Gory. "Sebas has been on my radar for a few years now,' said Woody, "but I've selfishly kept him my dirty little secret He was the ONLY choice for this position.

iHeart Radio Music Festival Returns To Las Vegas; Renews With Macys

THE MOUTH, APRIL 1ST, 2015 –– iHeartMedia today announced that its fifth annual, star-studded iHeartRadio Music Festival will return to MGM Grand in Las Vegas on September 18 and 19, 2015 with a lineup to be announced in the coming months, and that its daytime music showcase, the iHeartRadio Music Festival Village featuring interactive experiences, will return to the MGM Resorts Village across from the Luxor Hotel & Casino on Saturday afternoon. The company also announced a renewed partnership with Macy's to find America's next "Macy's iHeartRadio Rising Star." For the fourth year, Macy's iHeartRadio Rising Star talent search will provide 25 emerging artists the chance to perform on the same stage as music's biggest stars at the 2015 iHeartRadio Music Festival and at select Macy's events this fall. "This partnership has become part of the fabric of the iHeartRadio Music Festival and iHeartMedia is proud to join forces with Macy's for the fourth year," said Jeff Howard, President of National Sales for iHeartMedia. "Each year the iHeartRadio Music Festival and Village crush all expectations, truly pushing the boundaries of what live music is and creating once-in-a-lifetime fan experiences. Add on top of that, the ability to launch new music through the Macy's iHeartRadio Rising Star campaign and it creates one massive and unforgettable event that can't be seen anywhere else."

NETWORKS: Ace & TJ Begin 13th Year At WQEN/Birmingham Affiliate; Envision Adds 20 New Affiliates In March

THE MOUTH, APRIL 1ST, 2015 –– April 1, 2015 starts year 13 for The Ace & TJ Show at iHeartMedia's WQEN/Birmingham, AL after a new long term agreement was reached today. Throughout nearly the entire term, Market Manager, Ray Quinn and Regional Programming Manager Tom Hanrahan have assisted to make The Ace & TJ Show a top show in the highly competitive morning show landscape of Birmingham. "Ace & TJ have connected with listeners in Birmingham honestly from that first week 13 years ago. When you have a show that delivers consistent ratings and drives revenue, why change? They get it and we’re proud to have them Sas part of family for many years to come." – Tom Hanrahan, Regional Programming Manager/Alabama “After more than a decade on 103.7 the Q we are thrilled that iHeart Media SVPP, Rod Phillips and Regional Programming Manager, Tom Hanarhan see the value in this team for not only the station, but advertisers and listeners. As always we thank our radio family for making this possible.” -Ace “We really appreciate the fact that iHeart Birmingham is trusting us enough to come in and out of their beautiful facility for 3 more years. Even after they caught us stealing during the first year we were there.” -TJ Now in its 15th year of syndication, The Ace & TJ Show syndicates to the formats CHR, Hot AC, Classic Hits and Country. Syndication information is available by emailing Adam Goodman at AGoodman@AceTJ.com. Digital development is syndicated through The Radio Button and is heard 24/7 on The Ace & TJ Button and through

During the month of March, Envision Networks® was proud to welcome the following 20 new affiliates: WQSH-FM/Albany, NY (The Rooster) KZLE-FM/Little Rock, AR (Chop Shop Classic) KYVA-FM; KYVA-AM; KXXI-FM and KYAT-FM/Albuquerque, NM and KSHA-FM; KQMS-FM; KRRX-FM; KNRO-AM; KRDG-FM and KNNN-FM/Redding, CA (SpotVO and ExpressVO) KYUN-FM/Twin Falls, ID (AmeriCountry) KLPX-FM/Tucson, AZ (Guest Services) WVIC-FM/Lansing, MI (DUKE FM) WQON-FM/Traverse City, MI (Paul Shaffer’s Day in Rock) KAMS-FM/Springfield, MO (Imaging Chop Shop) WERX-FM; WOBR-FM and WRSF-FM/Nags Head, NC (Audiant)TheRadioButton.com.

EXECUTIVE ACTION: WWO Beefs Up Midwest Sales Team

THE MOUTH, APRIL 1ST, 2015 –– Westwood One announced that it has hired two veteran sales executives in its Midwest office. Zack Ficke joins the company as VP, Strategic Partnerships, and Kelli Hurley comes on board as VP, National Partnerships and Digital Activation, Midwest. Ficke, Hurley and Doug Johnston are reunited, having all recently crossed over from Premiere Networks. Ficke spent the past seven years as a National Account Manager with Premiere Networks. Prior to joining Premiere, he was a National Account Manager at SiriusXM. Before embarking on his media sales career, Ficke served in various sales and account management roles for Marriott's Vacation Club division and IT consulting firm, Apex Systems. Hurley is a network radio veteran with more than 10 years’ experience under her belt. She started her career in Los Angeles, successfully managing clients and agencies for Premiere Networks, United Stations, and Westwood One. Most recently, Kelli worked at Premiere Networks as a National Account Manager. Doug Johnston has put together an incredible team of sellers in our Midwest region,” said Steve Shaw, Westwood One President. “Zack and Kelli will only enhance our efforts to be the best client partners in the business. We are moving the mark and delivering results across all of our assets.”

iHeart Radio Now Available In BMW

THE MOUTH, APRIL 1ST, 2015 –– BMW Group announced that iHeartRadio is now available to BMW and MINI drivers. Demos of the iHeartRadio integration are available Wednesday, April 1 and Thursday, April 2 on the BMW Stand at the 2015 New York International Auto Show, inside the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center in Manhattan. All iHeartRadio users on iOS can now enjoy a seamless listening experience in BMW and MINI ready vehicles. Features include: Access to thousands of iHeartRadio's live radio stations from across the country and a catalog of more than 20 million songs and 800,000 artists to create custom stations. A personalized "For You" feature with tailored recommendations based on listeners' specific music preferences. Access to saved Favorites, with the ability to add or remove stations. Browse recent stations, including live and custom radio stations based on a song or artist. The ability to Thumbs up/Thumbs down songs to create a more personalized experience. Comfortable and safe to use with the BMW iDrive Controller or MINI Controller. Beginning today, when the iHeartRadio for Auto app is downloaded from the Apple App Store, it will be compatible with any BMW equipped with the BMW Apps option as well as MINI Connected ready vehicles.

[WATCH] Radio Host Prevails In Celebrity Jalapeno Eating Contest

THE MOUTH, APRIL 1ST, 2015 –– Our thoughts went out this morning to show members of Bob 106.9 Charleston's Tim Leary Show who claimed victory in a local Celebrity Jalapeno Eating Contest. According to WJCL TV, when it was all said and done, the real winner was the American Diabetes Association. WJCL Sports Director Frank Sulkowski and Bob 106.9 Morning Show host Tim Leary went head to head in a celebrity jalapeno eating contest Tuesday night. About a dozen brave competitors took part in the event sponsored by the Phi Pigma Kappa fundraising team for the Kiss a Pig campaign. Money raised from the event going to the American Diabetes Association. When it ended, Leary would down nearly five, whole jalapenos in a minute. His competition managed two peppers. “I just didn’t take my training seriously,” says Sulkowski. “Hats off to Tim for getting the job done. Jockline can only wonder how his fellow show members managed this morning. Yikes! Tim Leary also host the syndicated 'The 2020 Country Countdown' on USRN.'
